description: Formed as punctili(o) +â€Ž -ar, initially as an alternative translation (instead of punctual) for the German punktuell.

adjectives.description: punctiliar (comparative more punctiliar, superlative most punctiliar)

definitionGroups.group: (grammar) Of or pertaining to an unextended point of time:

entries.meaning: (of an action) Occurring at a definite and particular point in time.
(of verbal aspect or tense) Relating to a punctiliar action or event.
(grammar) A verb denoting a punctiliar action or activity.
examples: Many researchers observe similar generalizations: that children seem unwilling to mark activity verbs like walk or unbounded punctiliars like jump with an -ed ending, even though this is a tense marker in the adult language that applies to all types of events.
